page.title: 08LANDSCAPE, N CREAKE
page.content: North Creake is an example of a linear village, strung along the B 1355 Fakenham-Burnham Market road. From the southern boundary of the parish in the village of the River Burn, the road rised to higher ground to the north. The parish church is close to the southern boundary, so the village lacks a focal point of interest. This area has light, well drained soil on chalk; arable country with a low rainfall, not counducive to a dairy farming of stock cattle industry. Most of the land, traditionally, has been in the possession of one large estate; there is just one resident farmer, who works his own land, and lives in his own farmhouse. There are several small holdings, rented from the owners of the estate.
